verses.verse: (Ode for a Royal Wedding) To the leader: according to Lilies. Of the Korahites. A Maskil. A love song. (Ezra 7.6) My heart overflows with a goodly theme; I address my verses to the king; my tongue is like the pen of a ready scribe.
(Lk 4.22) You are the most handsome of men; grace is poured upon your lips; therefore God has blessed you forever.
(Isa 9.6) Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one, in your glory and majesty.
(Rev 6.2) In your majesty ride on victoriously for the cause of truth and to defend (Cn: Heb and the meekness of) the right; let your right hand teach you dread deeds.
Your arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies; the peoples fall under you.
(Ps 93.2; 98.9; Heb 1.8, 9) Your throne, O God, (Or Your throne is a throne of God, it) endures forever and ever. Your royal scepter is a scepter of equity;
(Ps 21.6; 33.5; 79.4; Isa 61.1) you love righteousness and hate wickedness. Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness beyond your companions;
(Song 1.3) your robes are all fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia. From ivory palaces stringed instruments make you glad;
(1 Kings 2.19; Song 6.8) daughters of kings are among your ladies of honor; at your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.
(Deut 21.13) Hear, O daughter, consider and incline your ear; forget your people and your father’s house,
(Ps 95.6; Isa 54.5) and the king will desire your beauty. Since he is your lord, bow to him;
(Ps 22.29) Daughter Tyre will seek your favor with gifts, the richest of the people
(Isa 61.10) with all kinds of wealth. The princess is decked in her chamber with gold-woven robes; (Or people. 13All glorious is the princess within, gold embroidery is her clothing)
(v 9|PSA 45:9; Song 1.4) in many-colored robes she is led to the king; behind her the virgins, her companions, follow.
With joy and gladness they are led along as they enter the palace of the king.
(1 Pet 2.9; Rev 1.6; 20.6) In the place of ancestors you, O king, (Heb lacks O king) shall have sons; you will make them princes in all the earth.
(Ps 138.4; Mal 1.11) I will cause your name to be celebrated in all generations; therefore the peoples will praise you forever and ever.
